marketNews.title: BI Cuts Interest Rate, Downgrades Credit Growth & Economic Projections
marketNews.content:
Bank Indonesia decided to cut the BI Rate by -25 bps to 5.5% today, Wednesday (21/5), with the deposit facility and lending facility also decreasing by -25 bps to levels of 4.75% and 6.25% respectively. This decision is in line with consensus expectations.

Bank Indonesia Governor, Perry Warjiyo, stated that this decision is an effort to support domestic economic growth which is beginning to slow down. Bank Indonesia itself cut its economic growth target for 2025 from +4.7-5.5% to +4.6-5.4%, marking the second downgrade by the central bank this year. For context, the realization of Indonesian economic growth in 1Q25 reached only +4.87% YoY, lower than the government's target of +5.2% YoY and marking the weakest growth since 3Q21.

Bank Indonesia also cut the credit growth target from the range of +11-13% YoY to approximately +8-11% YoY. This step follows the slowdown in banking credit growth in 4M25, which only grew +8.88% YoY (vs. 1Q25: +9.16% YoY) due to weakening demand and tightening liquidity. Banking credit growth in 4M25 marks the weakest growth since 7M23.

In addition to cutting the interest rate, Bank Indonesia announced it will lower the macroprudential liquidity ratio for conventional and sharia banks, by -100 bps to levels of 4% and 2.5% respectively. The foreign funding ratio for banks will also be increased by +5 percentage points to a maximum of 35% of bank capital. Both of these policies will be implemented starting June 1, 2025.

Bank Indonesia expects The Fed to cut interest rates by -50 bps by the end of 2025 following a lower inflation outlook due to the de-escalation of the trade war. Bank Indonesia's expectation aligns with the consensus expectation, where analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool as of today expects a Fed interest rate cut of ≥50 bps by the end of 2025, with a probability reaching 72.1%.

Perry affirmed that Indonesia's inflation outlook remains within the target range of 1.5-3.5% YoY. To maintain the stability of the Rupiah exchange rate, Bank Indonesia will continue interventions in the forex and bond markets, as well as optimization of instruments such as SRBI, SVBI, and SUVBI.

Following today's BI Rate cut announcement, the IHSG closed up +0.67% and the Rupiah to USD exchange rate strengthened +0.12% to the level of 16,383, while the 10-year government bond yield fell -23 bps to the level of 6.828%.

Key Takeaway

We assess that Bank Indonesia has room to continue cutting interest rates following the strengthening of the Rupiah exchange rate and the prospect of future US interest rate cuts. Current consensus expects Bank Indonesia to cut the BI Rate by another -25 bps until the end of 2025, based on surveys from Bloomberg and Reuters.

We recommend that investors stay invested, especially in sectors sensitive to monetary policy easing, such as banking ($BBCA, $BBRI, $BMRI, $BBNI) and property ($SMRA, $CTRA, $PWON, $BSDE). Investors also need to watch the release of US Producer Price Index inflation data and the Fed meeting to get a clearer picture regarding the future prospect of Bank Indonesia's interest rate cuts.

tickerNews.title: TPIA Subsidiary Mentioned to Target IPO with Valuation of at Least US$1 Billion
tickerNews.content: $TPIA: Bloomberg reported that Chandra Asri Pacific's subsidiary in infrastructure investment, PT Chandra Daya Investasi, is targeting a valuation of at least 1 billion US dollars or 16.4 trillion rupiah in its IPO on the IDX, aiming to raise more than 100 million dollars or ~1.6 trillion rupiah. Bloomberg sources mentioned that this plan is still subject to change, while a spokesperson for TPIA declined to comment on the issue. Previously, Bisnis Indonesia reported in early May 2025 that PT Chandra Daya Investasi planned to conduct an IPO of up to ~12.5 billion shares at a price range of 170-190 rupiah per share, resulting in maximum proceeds from this corporate action reaching ~2.4 trillion rupiah. Bisnis Indonesia explained that their report was based on the initial prospectus of PT Chandra Daya Investasi which they obtained.

tickerNews.title: ENRG to Hold Private Placement of up to ~2.5 Billion New Shares
tickerNews.content: $ENRG: Energi Mega Persada plans to hold a private placement of up to ~2.5 billion new shares with an dilution effect of up to 9.09%. The exercise price and prospective investors have not yet been announced, while the proceeds are intended for working capital and capital expenditure. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on June 26, 2025.

tickerNews.title: BAYU Announces 2024 Book Year Dividend Payout
tickerNews.content: $BAYU: Bayu Buana will distribute dividends for the 2024 book year amounting to ~35.3 billion rupiah or 100 rupiah per share, equivalent to a ~35% dividend payout ratio and indicating a dividend yield of 7.1% as of Wednesday (21/5). The cum date on the regular and negotiation market is May 26, 2025, while payment will be on June 19, 2025.

tickerNews.title: CPIN Shareholders Approve 2024 Book Year Dividend Distribution
tickerNews.content: $CPIN: Charoen Pokphand Indonesia shareholders approved the distribution of dividends for the 2024 book year amounting to ~1.8 trillion rupiah or 108 rupiah per share, equivalent to a ~48% dividend payout ratio and indicating a dividend yield of 2.2% as of Wednesday (21/5). The cum date and payment date are not yet known.

tickerNews.title: GIAA to Purchase Boeing Aircraft to Balance Trade Balance with the US, Per Minister of SOEs Statement
tickerNews.content: $GIAA: Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, stated that Garuda Indonesia will purchase Boeing aircraft to balance the trade balance between Indonesia and the US, which is one of the US's demands in tariff negotiations. Erick mentioned that GIAA will order the same number of aircraft as in the previous order contract. In 2014, GIAA ordered 50 units of Boeing 737 Max 8 aircraft, but GIAA only received 1 aircraft before canceling the contract in 2021 in response to the crash incidents involving the aircraft series. Erick's statement came less than a week after Bloomberg reported that GIAA was negotiating with BPI Danantara regarding a capital injection to improve the company's finances.

tickerNews.title: TLKM Clarifies that Suspect Designation Follows Preliminary Findings from DKI Jakarta High Prosecutor's Office Internal Audit into Fictitious Financing Case
tickerNews.content: $TLKM: Telkom Indonesia stated in a clarification to the IDX that the designation of suspects related to the alleged fictitious financing corruption case valued at 431 billion rupiah reported by the media Tempo and Kompas was a follow-up to findings from the DKI Jakarta High Prosecutor's Office based on the company's internal audit. This case is still under investigation by the DKI Jakarta High Prosecutor's Office, where to date, 10 individuals have been named suspects.

tickerNews.title: PGAS Signs Six Natural Gas Purchase Agreements and Heads of Agreement
tickerNews.content: $PGAS: Perusahaan Gas Negara signed 6 natural gas purchase agreements that cover 0.9 BBTUD from Pertamina Geothermal Energy ($PGEO), 12-17 BBTUD (ramp up) from Pertamina EP West Java, 0.35 BBTUD from Minarak Brantas Gas Inc., 3.99 BBTUD with PHE Ogan Komering, 8.48 BBTUD through an amendment to the purchase agreement from PHE North Sumatera Offshore, and 4.5-11 BBTUD through an amendment to the purchase agreement from Pertamina EP Medan. In addition to gas purchases, PGAS also signed a heads of agreement with Petronas Bukit Panjang to secure potential natural gas supply up to 31 BBTUD.

tickerNews.title: Bank Indonesia Records Banking Credit Growth Slowdown in 4M25
tickerNews.content: Bank Indonesia noted that banking credit growth slowed to +8.88% YoY in 4M25 (vs. 1Q25: +9.16% YoY), below Bank Indonesia's 2025 target range of +11-13% YoY, marking the weakest growth since July 2023. With this development, Bank Indonesia projects banking credit growth during 2025 will be in the range of +8-11% YoY. Based on usage, investment credit grew +15.86% YoY in 4M25, while consumer credit was +8.97% YoY and working capital was +4.62% YoY. Meanwhile, sharia financing in 4M25 grew +8.85% YoY and MSME credit growth reached +2.6% YoY.

tickerNews.title: US Government Received Intelligence Reports on Possible Israeli Strike on Iranian Nuclear Facilities
tickerNews.content: CNN reported that the US government received intelligence reports regarding Israel's plan to strike Iranian nuclear facilities, amidst US government efforts to reach a diplomatic agreement to limit Iran's nuclear program. Anonymous US officials who were CNN sources mentioned that it is still unknown whether Israel has made a final decision regarding this plan and whether this plan indicates that Israel disagrees with the US regarding the nuclear deal with Iran.

tickerNews.title: China's Gold Imports Surged in April 2025, Highest in 11 Months
tickerNews.content: Chinese Customs recorded that China imported 127.5 tons of gold in April 2025 (+73% MoM), marking the highest level in the last 11 months despite gold prices setting an all-time high. Bloomberg reported that the increase in gold imports by China was likely driven by the decision of the Chinese central bank to allocate new quotas to several commercial banks in April 2025, as a response to strong demand from institutional and retail investors amid the peak of the trade war.

tickerNews.title: Indonesia's Coal Exports to China Dropped in April 2025
tickerNews.content: Indonesian coal exports to China in April 2025 fell -20% YoY to 14.286 million tons, based on Chinese customs data. This result caused Indonesian coal exports to China over 4M25 to drop -5% YoY to ~66.9 million tons. Reuters reported that the plunge in Indonesian coal exports to China in April 2025 occurred along with Chinese importers refusing to use the Reference Coal Price (HBA) as the purchase reference price. Furthermore, domestic coal prices in China, which hit a 4-year low, also suppressed imports, causing China's total coal imports in April 2025 to drop -16% YoY.

tickerNews.title: SKK Migas Claims Chevron, TotalEnergies, and Shell Will Reinvest in Indonesian Upstream Oil and Gas Sector
tickerNews.content: Head of SKK Migas, Djoko Siswanto, claimed on Tuesday (20/5) that Chevron, TotalEnergies, and Shell will reinvest in the Indonesian upstream oil and gas (migas) sector. Djoko also claimed that besides these three companies, there are 22 other companies that have expressed interest in conducting exploration in various domestic hydrocarbon basins. The government itself will auction 60 oil and gas working areas until 2028, focusing on the eastern Indonesian regions that have not been widely developed.

tickerNews.title: BPI Danantara COO Aims to Reduce SOEs from 800 to Around 200 Companies via Mergers and Closures
tickerNews.content: COO of BPI Danantara, Dony Oskaria, stated on Tuesday (20/5) that his party plans to reduce the number of SOEs and their subsidiaries from around 800 companies to approximately 200 companies. BPI Danantara is currently conducting a review targeted for completion in October 2025. This consolidation plan aims to ensure the remaining 200 SOEs and their subsidiaries are competitive and globally oriented.

tickerNews.title: DPR Plans to Draft New Regulations Specifically Governing Online Transportation
tickerNews.content: Kompas reported that the DPR plans to draft new regulations specifically governing online transportation separate from Law No. 22/2009 concerning Road Traffic and Land Transportation. This step is intended to provide a solution to the prolonged problems complained about by approximately 7 million online motorcycle taxi (ojol) drivers throughout Indonesia. Today, Wednesday (21/5), Kompas reported that Commission V of the DPR held a hearing with ojol drivers as material for drafting the regulations.

tickerNews.title: Bank DKI Director Says IPO Permit Obtained from OJK and Jakarta Provincial Government
tickerNews.content: President Director of Bank DKI, Agus H. Widodo, stated on Tuesday (20/5) that they have obtained permission from OJK and the DKI Jakarta Provincial Government to carry out an IPO, although he did not detail when the corporate action would be executed.

tickerNews.title: TRON Plans Rights Issue and Expansion into Electricity Sales Business
tickerNews.content: Teknologi Karya Digital Nusa ($TRON) plans to hold a rights issue of up to ~384 million new shares with a dilution effect of up to 11.5%. The exercise price has not been announced, while the proceeds are intended to strengthen the capital structure and increase stock liquidity. In addition to the rights issue plan, TRON also announced a plan to expand its business activities in the electricity sales sector. Both plans will be discussed at the EGM on June 26, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Between Dividends and Growth and How to Optimize Both
tickerNews.content: "Never forget that stock returns come in 2 forms, namely capital gains and dividends—there are times when capital gains dominate, and there are times when dividends become very meaningful." - parahitairawan
